Chapter 21, Part 2: The Ten Stages of Progression of Vajra Banner Bodhisattva
Buddha's disciple!
What are the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's third stage of progression towards the realization of the equality of all buddhas?
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva follows and studies the stage of progression towards the realization of the equality of all buddhas of the past, future, and present.
When this bodhisattva cultivates bodhisattva practices, seeing good and evil forms, his mind is pure and free from aversion and attachment;
he is joyful and delighted, gives rise to an indestructible mind, and is free from all worries and distress;
he attains an upright mind, his body and mind are soft and supple, and his faculties are cool and refreshing.
When this bodhisattva attains such joy, he dedicates it to all buddhas and thinks like this:

'Although all buddhas have the unsurpassed pure and wondrous bliss, may the buddhas further possess the inconceivable bliss of abiding in buddhahood, fully embrace the immeasurable bliss of the buddhas' samÄdhi, accomplish the bliss of immeasurable great compassion, fully accomplish the bliss of the buddhas' liberation beyond measure, fully embrace the bliss of the buddhas' spiritual powers and self-mastery, the unsurpassed, most revered, and sublime bliss;

May it universally cover the TathÄgatas, always enabling them to fully possess the bliss of the buddhas' immeasurable powers, forever free from the bliss of all conceptual thoughts, the unsurpassed bliss of tranquility and immutability;
Fully endowed with the unobstructed Dharma gate, the mind always tranquil and concentrated without distraction, the indestructible bliss of the Buddha's non-dual practice.'

The Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, having thus dedicated the wholesome roots to the buddhas, further dedicate them to all bodhisattvas, enabling those whose vows are not yet fulfilled to fully fulfill them;
Those whose straightforward mind is not yet pure to purify their straightforward mind;
Those who have not yet fulfilled the perfections, they will all be fulfilled, and they will abide in the vajra mind of enlightenment;
In all-knowledge, they will attain irreversibility, not abandon the great adornments, and guard the gate of enlightenment and all wholesome roots;
They will be able to cause all sentient beings to abandon heedlessness and give rise to the mind of enlightenment;
Their vows will be fulfilled, they will abide in all the abodes of bodhisattvas, attain the bodhisattvas' clear and sharp faculties, cultivate wholesome roots, and realize omniscience.
In this way, bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, having dedicated the wholesome roots to the bodhisattvas,
Further dedicate them to all sentient beings, dedicating to all sentient beings seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma,
Respecting the Saá¹…gha with a reverent mind, dedicating to the fulfillment of single-minded mindfulness of the Buddha, dedicating to the fulfillment of mindfulness of the pure
Wondrous Dharma, dedicating to the mindfulness of the Saá¹…gha with respect and reverence, dedicating to seeing the Buddha without ever being apart from
They dedicate to perfecting all pure minds, to discerning the teachings of the TathÄgatas,

to perfecting immeasurable merits, to purifying the wholesome roots of the supernormal knowledges, and to eliminating all doubts and confusion. Just as the Buddhas dedicate [their merits] to guiding and transforming all sentient beings, hearers,
solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas, the bodhisattvas dedicate their wholesome roots to all sentient beings in the same way;
causing all sentient beings to forever leave behind the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, and the realms of Yama, as well as all evil destinies and immeasurable difficulties.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cause all those sentient beings to give rise to the unsurpassed bodhi mind, to nurture the unsurpassed bodhi mind, to single-mindedly seek omniscience, to abandon slandering the Buddhas' right Dharma, and to always delight in perfecting the stage of omniscience;
causing all sentient beings to ultimately attain purity and omniscience.
The wholesome roots practiced by bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are embraced by great vows, and the practices, accumulations, and cultivations are all vast and complete.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are laypeople living with their wives and children, they should never for a moment part from the bodhi mind. Rightly contemplating the realm of omniscience, they should liberate themselves and others, with an upright and impartial mind, skillfully demonstrating their wives and children.
Bodhisattvas' skillful wisdom and expedient means are all accomplished and ultimately liberated. Although living together, their minds are unattached;

because of their original great compassion, they dwell in the household life, and because of their great kindness, they accord with their wives and children, without obstructing the pure path of bodhisattvas.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are laypeople, they should dedicate their wholesome roots with this omniscience mind, namely:

Whether putting on clothes, drinking, eating, taking medicine, walking, standing, sitting, lying down, or engaging in the activities of body, speech, and mind, they are completely pure, their faculties are subdued, they are all at ease, they bathe and anoint their bodies, they walk in tranquil and slow steps, they turn and look back with dignity, they lift and lower their feet, whether sleeping or awake, they do not lose their dignified demeanor, they skillfully control their faculties, and they are never distracted.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, with all these practices, never depart from the mind of omniscience.

They dedicate their roots of goodness to benefiting and bringing peace and happiness to all sentient beings, and accomplish immeasurable vows.ğŸ”½They gather immeasurable vast roots of goodness, cultivate roots of goodness to rescue and protect all, and eliminate all negligence and arrogance.
They single-mindedly contemplate omniscience,
wish to awaken to all the buddhas' enlightenment, and abandon afflictions and dharmas that accord with afflictions.
Cultivating all the practices of bodhisattvas, unobstructed in the path to omniscience, delighting in
cultivating the stage of wisdom and all wholesome roots, always delighting in kind speech, causing wholesome roots to increase, causing

all sentient beings to forever be free from suffering and distress, not attached to their practices, single-mindedly upholding the teachings of the buddhas, this is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dwelling in the householder's status, taking up wholesome roots,
single-mindedly dedicating them to unsurpassed enlightenment.
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva further thinks like this:

'Even down to small dogs and other animals, I should cause them to fully cultivate the practice of heedfulness, leave behind the animal realm, attain beneficial happiness, ultimately be liberated, forever cross the ocean of suffering, suffering, the aggregate of suffering, the perception of suffering, the great suffering of predominance, the practice of suffering, the storehouse of suffering, the root of suffering, the abode of suffering, and such immeasurable and boundless all sufferings.'

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, wishing to cause all sentient beings to attain complete extinction, use their pure wholesome roots to dedicate to unsurpassed enlightenment, teaching all sentient beings to dedicate in this way. They contemplate and think of those wholesome roots as foremost;
Namely:

Dedicating to the cognition of all aspects, giving rise to the mind of enlightenment, embracing the mind of enlightenment, distancing oneself from birth and death, cultivating wholesome roots, emerging from the abyss of birth and death, attaining the unimpeded bliss of the tathÄgatas;
Cultivating the tathÄgatas' loving-kindness, filling the ten directions, with great compassion benefiting all sentient beings;

Universally enabling all to attain pure bliss, guarding all supreme wholesome roots, causing all sentient beings to ultimately attain the Buddha's teachings, distancing themselves from all the realms of mÄras, entering the profound realms of the tathÄgatas, universally able to pull out all worlds, replete with all the tathÄgatas' wholesome roots, abiding in the equal Dharma of the buddhas of the three times.
In this way, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas now gathering wholesome roots, having gathered wholesome roots, and will gather wholesome roots, all dedicate them.
He further thinks like this:

'Just as those past bodhisattvas practiced, respectfully making offerings to all buddhas, liberating sentient beings, protecting all, cultivating wholesome roots and dedicating them to enlightenment without attachment;

Not relying on form, not attached to feeling, not having inverted thoughts, not creating volitional formations, not grasping consciousness, being free from the six sense bases, not dwelling in worldly dharmas, delighting in supramundane dharmas, knowing dharmas to be like space, ultimately reaching the other shore that is not a destination, illuminating and understanding that all dharmas are unborn and unceasing, without true characteristics, without attachment, all dharmas are without falsehood, without a place to return to, without destruction, abiding in reality, without self-nature, because they are free from natures.

In a single thought, they understand that all dharmas are natureless and have nature, and always delight in practicing the roots of goodness of the universal gate, fully endowed with the TathÄgata's perfect merits, manifesting all.
Just as the roots of goodness of all TathÄgatas of the past were dedicated, so am I.
Delighting in such dharmas, realizing such dharmas, giving rise to such an aspiration, cultivating all dharmas without contradicting the characteristics of dharmas;

All arising dharmas are like illusions, like lightning, like the moon in water, like reflections in a mirror, conditionally assembled, provisionally maintaining all dharmas, fully discriminating and knowing them to arise from karmic causes, with only the stage of the TathÄgata being the ultimate abode.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should thus follow the past buddhas in learning and dedicating, and so should the future and present [buddhas].
Having learned and dedicated the roots of goodness of the buddhas of the three times, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thinks like this:
'Just as those Buddhas know the bodhisattva's dedication, I also dedicate like this:

The foremost dedication, the supreme dedication, the most supreme dedication, the superior dedication, the unsurpassed dedication, the unequaled dedication, the incomparable dedication, the unequaled dedication, the honored dedication, the wondrous dedication, the equal dedication, the upright dedication, the great merit dedication, the great vow dedication, the bright and pure dedication, the good dedication, the pure dedication, the free from evil dedication, the non-following evil dedication.'

In this way, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, having correctly dedicated the roots of goodness, achieves a pure and wondrous body, speech, and mind. All actions and practices are completely pure. Abiding in the bodhisattva's abode, free from the abode of evil, cultivating the roots of goodness, free from evil actions of body and speech, the mind without discrimination, cultivating sarvajÃ±a.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's equal dedication to the buddhas.
At that time, Vajra Banner Bodhisattva, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, universally observed the ten directions and spoke in verse, saying:
Those bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate the dedication Dharma of past buddhas,

All kinds of subtle and wonderful bliss praised by the buddhas and tathÄgatas,

The bodhisattva's various kinds of bodily bliss, the faculties of the eyes, ears, nose, and tongue,

All the pleasures in the various destinies, the pleasure of the soft and subdued faculties,

In the immeasurable worlds of the ten directions, embracing all classes of sentient beings,

Not for one's own sake seeking happiness, wishing to bring peace and security to all,
Far from all false and deluded thoughts, fully understanding all dharmas as empty and selfless.
The most supreme ones in the ten directions, all the true Buddha's disciples that are seen,
With all merits, dedicate them to them, quickly enabling them to ultimately attain the unsurpassed path.
All the various kinds of sentient beings in the world, equally embracing them without exception,
With the pure karma that I practice, enabling those sentient beings to quickly attain Buddhahood.
Immeasurable and boundless pure vows, spoken by the unsurpassed most supreme ones,
All completely pure, free from defilements, universally enabling the Buddha's disciples to ultimately fulfill them.

To be adorned with various pure and wonderful things - the bodhisattvas study and dedicate in this way.

With innumerable garland canopies, up to innumerable garland adornments, I make offerings;
With inconceivable fragrant ointments and canopies, up to inconceivable fragrant ointment adornments, as offerings;
With immeasurable powdered incense canopies, up to immeasurable powdered incense adornments, as offerings;ğŸ”½With boundless fine cloth canopies, up to boundless fine cloth adornments, as offerings;
With boundless jeweled canopies, up to boundless various jewel adornments, as offerings;ğŸ”½With immeasurable lamp canopies, up to immeasurable various lamp adornments, as offerings;

With inconceivable numbers of jeweled canopies, jeweled banners, jeweled pennants, jeweled nets, jeweled garlands, jeweled lights, jeweled flames, jeweled clouds, jeweled seats, jeweled wheels, jeweled palaces, jeweled worlds, jeweled Mount Sumerus, jeweled seas, jeweled rivers, jeweled trees, jeweled garments, and jeweled lotus flowers, such inconceivable numbers of jeweled adornments were used for offerings.

Giving rise to immeasurable wholesome roots in the three times, enabling all sentient beings to see immeasurable buddhas, abiding in all wholesome roots, accomplishing the Great Vehicle, not attached to any dharmas, replete with all wholesome roots, ultimately immeasurable practices, universally entering immeasurable and boundless all dharma realms, wholesome roots dedicating to;
Entering all tathÄgatas' sovereign spiritual powers, enabling all sentient beings to attain sarvajÃ±a through these wholesome roots, accomplishing the unsurpassed path.
Just as there is no self apart from all dharmas, my wholesome roots are also like this;
Embracing all buddhas, because of respectfully making offerings;
Embracing all dharmas, because of being free from hindrances;
Embracing all bodhisattvas, because of ultimately the same wholesome roots;
Embracing all bodhisattva practices, because of fulfilling all vows;
Embracing all bodhisattva dharma-illuminations, because of being definitively unobstructed;
because they gather and take up the spiritual powers and sovereign abilities of all Buddhas, accomplishing immeasurable wholesome roots;
because they gather and take up the powers, fearlessness, and immeasurable minds of all Buddhas, fulfilling everything;
because they gather and take up the samÄdhis, dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, and eloquence of all good Å›rÄvakas, understanding the non-dual Dharma of the world;
because they gather and take up the skillful means of all Buddhas, manifesting the great spiritual powers of the TathÄgata;

because they gather and take up all Buddhas of the three times, giving rise to the attainment of the Way, turning the pure Dharma wheel, manifesting nirvÄá¹‡a, making offerings, and transforming sentient beings;
because they gather and take up all worlds, adorning the unsurpassed Buddha-lands;
because they gather and take up all kalpas, not cutting off all bodhisattva practices;

because they gather and take up all sentient beings, fully cultivating the practices of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva;
because they gather and take up all sentient beings, purifying the habits of afflictions;
To embrace the faculties of all sentient beings, in order to transform and liberate innumerable beings;

The Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus dedicates his wholesome roots, understanding that they are non-existent. In his actions, he does not grasp at false rewards, and in rewards, he does not grasp at false actions.
Free from all falsehood, he enters the profound Dharma realm, and his mind always abides in supreme and wonderful wholesome roots.
He is far removed from a scattered mind and cultivates wholesome dharmas.
He does not believe in or enter any dharmas, and does not see any dharmas with an accomplished intrinsic nature. The doer and the destroyer are both unobtainable.
Knowing that all dharmas are without independence, understanding the dharma realm, without seeing, without knowing.

Thus, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is perfect and complete, understanding all dharmas, attaining the ground of the multitude of causes and conditions of all dharmas, seeing all dharmas as the body, leaving behind the ultimate of desires, equally contemplating all dharmas, understanding the world to be like an illusion;
Clearly penetrating sentient beings, all of whom are one dharma, without discrimination of two.
Not abandoning the realm of the methods of various activities, emerging from the conditioned realm into the unconditioned realm, yet also not destroying the nature of the conditioned;
Emerging from the unconditioned realm into the conditioned realm, yet also not destroying the nature of the unconditioned.
Thus, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva delights in contemplating the quiescent characteristics of all dharmas, giving rise to all pure wholesome roots, all of which are dedicated to saving sentient beings;
Diligent in cultivating the dharma of leaving behind delusion, deeply penetrating and clearly understanding the ocean of all dharmas;
Using the wholesome roots equal to space and so forth to make dedications, to be replete with the unsurpassed firm merits;
To attain the removal of delusion and darkness, the bright and pure Dharma eye, and to skillfully know the means of dedicating merits.

The Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus dedicates the wholesome roots, causing all sentient beings to purify all lands, attain the mastery of the Buddha, teach and transform sentient beings, uphold the Buddha's teachings, and be the supreme field of blessings in all worlds;

For all worlds, to be the rising bright and pure sun. Each wholesome root fills the Dharma realm. The dedication of wholesome roots rescues and protects sentient beings, causing all sentient beings to fully accomplish pure merits.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dedicate their roots of goodness in this way, guarding and upholding the nature of all tathÄgatas, teaching and maturing the nature of all sentient beings, purifying the nature of all buddha-lands, the indestructible nature of karma, the nature of discriminating phenomena, the nature of equally contemplating non-duality, the nature of roaming everywhere in the ten directions, the nature of extensively expounding detachment, the nature of being fully liberated, and the nature of universally illuminating the faculties.

At that time, Vajra Banner Bodhisattva, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, surveyed the ten directions and spoke in verse, saying:
In all the inner and outer worlds, the great bodhisattvas are unattached,
Not abandoning the task of benefiting sentient beings - such wondrous wisdom is supreme among humans.
Not attached to any world, not grasping at the solidity of the ten directions,
Not grasping at the characteristics of sentient beings or life, also not falsely grasping at the world.
In all the worlds of the ten directions, embracing all sentient beings without exception,
Contemplating existence and non-existence, attaining mastery, skillfully dedicating to all places.
Embracing conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, the mind does not falsely grasp at the world.
The dharmas of the world are without distinction - the light illuminating the world awakens to this.
All the practices and actions one engages in, the superior, middling, and inferior are each different,

Bodhisattvas' dedications reach the other shore, and they accomplish the trainings of the tathÄgatas.
They discern the profound and subtle wisdom, and are endowed with the supreme and special Dharma.

They never falsely grasp at sentient beings, nor do they vainly think about dharmas.

In this way, the realm accords with and reaches everywhere, far removing all false thoughts.
The teacher who tames all sentient beings is fully endowed with clear and skillful dedication.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the fifth inexhaustible merit treasury dedication of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva cultivates the wholesome roots of repentance and is free from all karmic hindrances.
